title: The Great Giveaway - Eugene Castle
description:
The Great Giveaway, the Realities of Foreign Aid

The title gives away the message and approach of the book. Gathering in a wide range of arguments against foreign aid, the author grapples with the league of bureaucrats, bankers, businessmen, and--it sometimes appears--the U.S. Senate, which he finds devoted to the perpetuation and broadening of aid.


About the author:
 Founder of Castle Films in 1924, which distributed home movie editions of Hollywood films for forty years. He was a San Francisco newspaper reporter and newsreel cameraman before founding Castle Films. After he sold that company in the 1940s, he worked in New York City as an investment counselor
